result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J. Peavy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed/stayed with huber and 0 days credit in the event of revocation.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete counseling and/or programming required by the agent.  

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department if none already provided.  

Pay costs.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy J. Peavy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: and DOC Notice of Case Status Change

Defendant Billy J. Peavy in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states PSI has been filed; parties jointly request the Court adopt the agent's recommendations.  Atty. Edwards concurs; states agent's recommendation is proper.  Agent's recommendation:  imposed/stayed jail sentence of 6 months with probation.

Sentence:  6 mo jail i/s for probation of 2 years.  Attend, pay for, succ. complete counseling and/or programming required by agent.  Submit DNA sample if none already provided.  Pay costs.

Defendant Billy J. Peavy in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states that def will be entering a plea; State will be asking for PSI prior to sentencing (not certain at this time if it will be argued).  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 6/3 at 10.  Court does not order DNA sampling as def states it's already been provided.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No acts or threats of violence.  Defendant to submit to booking/printing at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before leaving the courthouse today (2/11/15).

Defendant Billy J. Peavy in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Edwards states def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of prelim.  Court accepts def's waiver and binds def over for trial.  Proceeding to arraignment, Court notes filing of the information.  Charge is the same as the complaint.  Formal reading waived.  Court states charge and informs def of possible max. penalties.  Atty. Edwards offers NG plea on def's behalf.  DA asks for 5k signature bond - no acts or threats of violence; printing before he leaves courthouse today.  So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Billy J. Peavy in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Edwards waives formal reading.  Court states charge and informs def of possible max. penalties as well as rights including right to prelim.  Def waives time limits for the prelim and requests status.  Court accepts waiver of time limits and sets status.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
